definition: Jonathan D Spence (1936-), distinguished British US historian of China, author of The search for modern China 追尋現代中國|追寻现代中国
history/annals/title of an official historian in ancient China
to move/to shift/to change (a position or location etc)/to promote

sentences.english: Jonathan D. Spence, The Question of Hu.

definition: James Legge (1815-1897), Scottish Protestant missionary in Qing China and translator of the Chinese classics into English
William A.P. Martin (1827-1916), American missionary who lived 62 years in China between 1850 and 1916, and helped found many Chinese colleges, first president of Peking University
Joseph Needham (1900-1995), British biochemist and author of Science and Civilization in China
Xiao Yishan (1902-1978), Modern historian of the Qing dynasty
Xiao Qian (1910-1999), Mongolian-born, Cambridge-educated journalist active during Second World War in Europe, subsequently famous author and translator
George Orwell (1903-1950), British novelist, author of Animal Farm 動物農場|动物农场 and 1984
